function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Reduced outdoor air requirement from 560 m3 to 119 m3 per hour may impact indoor air quality and increase risk of indoor air pollution.","Impact":"Increased risk of indoor air pollution-related health issues such as respiratory problems and allergies.","Mitigation":"Regular monitoring of indoor air quality, use of alternative air purification methods, and periodic ventilation.","Technologies":"Air quality sensors, indoor air purifiers, and ventilation systems.","People":"Building occupants, especially those with respiratory conditions.","Owner":"Building management, HVAC technicians, and health and safety officers."},{"Description":"Lack of reflection of temperature and RH effects from the botanical filter in the simulation may lead to inaccurate assessment of energy consumption and thermal comfort.","Impact":"Inaccurate energy consumption predictions and potential discomfort due to unaccounted temperature and humidity effects.","Mitigation":"Conducting field studies to measure actual temperature and humidity effects, and integrating a botanical filter model in the EnergyPlus software.","Technologies":"Data loggers, thermal comfort sensors, and advanced modeling software.","People":"Building designers, HVAC engineers, and energy analysts.","Owner":"Building management, HVAC technicians, and energy consultants."},{"Description":"Climate zones variability may impact the effectiveness of the DBAF, leading to varying levels of energy saving potential in different regions.","Impact":"Inconsistent energy saving potential and performance of the DBAF in different climate zones.","Mitigation":"Conducting region-specific energy saving assessments, adapting the DBAF design for different climate conditions, and providing climate-specific guidelines for DBAF implementation.","Technologies":"Climate data analysis tools, energy modeling software, and regional climate databases.","People":"Building designers, energy consultants, and HVAC engineers.","Owner":"Energy consultants, building management, and HVAC technicians."}]}
